intro: Mesembryanthemum ovatum, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, orange or yellow fruits that are often used in culinary applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as thick leaves and a shallow root system to conserve water. Mesembryanthemum ovatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the year in suitable climates.
